page.title: 18LANDSEER PARK,IPSWICH.
page.content: This large area of urban recreation, covers over 4 hectares adjacent to the large housing areas of South-East Ipswich. It is a good example of how wasteland can be turned into something useful. Formally a council waste dump,it has been landscaped,grassed,and wooded to provide a pleasant area of countryside within the town of Ipswich. Much of it,is for casual recreation, i.e walking over rolling grass slopes and through a small woodland.However organised recreation does exist,such as the BMX track(see page 17) and the adventure playground. One interesting feature is the presence of ventilation pipes to allow methane to escape from the buried material deep in the ground.
